page.title: 13NEWTONMORE CAMANACHD 1
page.content: The game of{shinty}has been played in the district of Badenoch, in which {Newtonmore}is situated, for as long as there is any record and certainly for more than a thousand years. Coming as it did from the root sport of {camanachd - the game of the curved {stick}- in Ireland, it has a place in the stories of the Celtic heroes as well as a growing collection of legends about the many outstanding players who have worn the blue and white hooped jerseys which are famous as the{Newtonmore}colours. {Shinty}is a skilful and exacting spectacle. It is played , twelve a side , with a slim-handled curved-headed stick, triangular in section. The ball is about the size of a tennis-ball, with a thick leather cover, which travels, at the point of contact at a speed of a 100 m.p.h.
